CatDescriptText: Mrs. Marvin Simmons, 279 Spaulding Street, Aliquippa, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 7, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think adults in the community are doing enough to foster constructive recreational activities, like playgrounds, centers, places to dance, Little Leagues, etc., for youth?" answer reads: "Yes, they are in my neighborhood.  We have adequate playgrounds and the supervision to go along with it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Marvin Simmons holding bag of groceries and box from Jenny Lee bakery, standing in front of block wall with "Whiteha..." smoking pipe display and paint cans in store window on right
